main event: Strange spherical, silvery object observed maneuvering in the sky over Santarém, Portugal on May 16, 1952.
interesting points: The object was initially observed as a brilliant sphere, then it exploded into several fragments or parts.
The fragments became horizontal lines or broken lines, and some remained horizontal and apparently stationary for some time.
The town of Santarém is a popular resort area, so there is a possibility that the description given is a garbled account of some natural phenomenon.
The report states that the spectacular display described did not actually occur as stated.
The report was prepared by Captain Frank J. Wojtasiak, USAF, and approved by Harrison R. Thorp, Chief of the Intelligence Division, Directorate of Plans.
sighted object: Spherical, silvery object that exploded into fragments
photographs: No photographs present in the provided image
